bib_record.title: -Measurement of the neutron-proton spin correlation coefficient Ayy at 90 degrees C.M. by elastic scattering of 13.7 MeV polarized neutrons from a polarized proton target.

free_txt: M.S., H.K., R.S. Experimental site.
G.M., W.T.
.An analyzing power value of 0.019 +- 0.002 was assumed
in the analysis.
.The data were corrected for background by subtracting
the yield outside the time-of-flight peak. Corrections
were also applied for dead-time and fluctuations in
the deuteron beam current.
A delta-E - E detector telescope, built
from two silicon barrier detectors, having an active
area of 12 mm in diameter and being 110 and 800 micro-
meters thick, respectively, was used to detect the
recoil protons. The telescope was placed at an angle
of 45 degrees and at a distance of 6 cm from the LMN
crystal.
A 10 cm diameter by 11.4 cm thick NE213 liquid
scintillation detector was used for neutron detection.
The detector was placed at an angle of 45 degrees and
at a distance of 60 cm from the LMN cell. Two similar
detectors, one placed in the beam direction and the
other above the scattering plane served as fluence
monitors. The distance from the LMN cell to these
detectors were 3 m.
.The polarization of the deuteron beam was monitored
with a carbon polarimeter.
One standard deviation. Includes counting
statistics and uncertainties in the neutron beam
polarization, the target polarization and the
analyzing power.
Erlangen Lamb-shift polarized ion source,
delivered 11.5 MeV vector polarized deuterons onto
a deuterium gas target. The target cell was 13 mm in
diameter by 50 mm thick, and filled to a pressure of
5 bar at a temperature of 77 K. The neutron polari-
zation was reversed every 50 sec.
Erlangen polarized proton target. It uses a
thin lanthanum magnesium nitrate (LMN), single crystal
doped with 1% Nd at the La sites. The protons
of the crystal water molecules were polarized by
dynamic nuclear orientation at low temperatures, 1.3K,
in a strong magnetic field, 1.85 T, using 70 GHz
microwaves. The LMN crystal had the shape of a slab,
300 micrometers thick and with a cross section area
of 6 by 6 mm. The distance from the center of the gas
cell to the LMN crystal was 10 cm.
polarized induced neutron source
Time-of-flight techniques was used to obtain
coincidences between the proton and neutron
detectors. Coincidences between the Si-detectors of
the telescope were also recorded.
The neutron detectors used PSD for neutron-
gamma discrimination.
Erlangen Lamb-shift polarized ion source descr.
.Tbl.2 from Nucl.Phys. A489,284,1988
